> <OLD>
>
> With deep breaths, Tucson cools down as nostrils flair to allow=
 faster
> cooling of his systems.  At the same time he raises his neck for =
another
> look around.  Then his head is swung ahead facing northward once =
again.  His
> long tail snaps at the ground beneath him, taking out what re=
mains of the
> dinosaur bones, smashing them to splinters.  It felt good to=
 roar, it helped
> to release trapped emotions that had built up over time.=
  Certainly Rodimus
> was trying his patience and it was a good method of n=
ot lashing out at him
> which would have been a grave mistake.  He continue=
s to wait for the Fuzors
> to arrive.  He thinks to himself as he does.

<N=
EW>

As TUSCON waited for the Maximal fuzors the other Predacons seemed to
=
give him a wide berth. DEEPSTRYKE continued to hover into the air far
above=
, his sensors probing over the dinosaurs, the Predacons and the
Maximals, m=
issing very little.

The predacons that could fly were still hover over the=
 dinosaurs just
watching the flames, their fire and heat doing all the work=
 of
destroying the dinosaur flesh. However the work was slow gooing and
the=
 Predacons were begining to mumble.

"This is burning up my heat exchanger.=
" One said.

Another said, "Yeah along with all our fuel reserves."

There =
was a pause as others began mumbling something similar all under
their brea=
th.

> <OLD - Straightshot>
>
> " Till all are one.   I most certainly hope=
 you're right about this,Primus.
> Our lives depend on your theory."
>
> Me=
anwhile, having been above in Waspinator's grasp, Straight Shot could
> act=
ually sense some good attributes in him if there were any to be sensed.
> A=
lthough they could never be allies she still could sense something positive=

> about him.  His sense of sticking to things even if he didn't like doing=

> them, was admirable and she felt he should be complemented.
>
> " Waspin=
ator, look I know you hate me with a passion and you aren't exactly
> on my=
 friends list but I want you to know that I really admire your loyalty
> to=
ward this mission and having the tolerance to work with an enemy bot.
> You=
're doing a really good job, keep it up."

<NEW>

WASPINATOR flies a little=
 higher as his wings buzz, "Waspinator is
better than dumb Maximals!" he sa=
ys as he scans over the dinosaur
remains. "But sometimes some Maximals do h=
ave a good point."

In his glee over STRAIGHTSHOT's comment WASPINATOR almo=
st dropped her,
but then buzzed down to catch her. "Sorry." he said sheepis=
hly before
flying on.

hen Sourge was around and she asked in low
> voice to  Nightshift =93do you=
 think that scourge eats little kittens?=94
>

> <OLD - Nightshift>
>
> Nig=
htshift keeps tabs on Scourge, being sure he keeps his distance.
>
> " Good=
 question, I think we better keep tabs on him.  Know'n that slagball,
> he'=
s look'n ta stir up some trouble.  But I don't think he eats kittens."

<NE=
W>

SCOURGE chuckled as he looked down on NIGHTSHIFT, his powerful sensors
=
desinged for tracking fleeing prey and searching for Maximals were
easily a=
ble to pick up on the conversation. "I have no designs on such
a little Max=
imal. There would be no sport in it."

Still in his hover craft mode SCOURG=
E just ahead, watching the
terrain. "One would think that such a young thin=
g would not be out
here in such a dangerous place." SCOURGE's words were no=
t precisly
caring as much as they were the words of a pure predator. There =
was
nothing specifically dangerous in them, but the tone indicated that
may=
be there was.

> <OLD - Hydras>
>
> hYDRAS hissed anoyed and said =93What a=
 waste of power, this saberback could
> have done a better use of his skill=
s=94
>

> <OLD - Tuscon>
>
> Tucson looks to Hydras,with a sarcastic expres=
sion.
>
> "If you think you can do better, be my guest."

<NEW - Fractyl>

=
A Predacon, his IFF signature identifying him as FRACTYL came flying
up to =
the area, from the southwest, his beast mode was a greenish
colored Pterano=
don. He flew over a few of the closer dinosaurs and
began spraying them wit=
h some sort of caustic liquid. More smoke and
black smoke rose from them, b=
ut the affect was that the creatures
began to melt as they were hit.

"Hydr=
as!" FRACTLY said excitedly over his comlink. "I think I have
another, fast=
er way to rid ourselves of these deceased reptiles."

(TAG)
